website_summaries.verdict: A versatile boat cover that fits most hull styles.
pros: Rear air vents allow moisture to escape
Quick release buckles and strap system provide added convenience
Sold with a free mesh storage bag
cons: Plastic clips sometimes break, even after limited use

customer_reviews.title: i mean sucks cuz i would have paid the extra money for ...
customer_reviews.text: So the size is way off my boat is 16 ft by 84 inces wide and so I bought the one that said 14-16 ft and up to 90 inches wide cuz i figured that would be more than enough and i didnt want it fitting way to big well it barely streched out to cover the back corners, i mean sucks cuz i would have paid the extra money for the one that fits but now im not sure if i can return it and well u can see on the pics it just doesnt look right, but as a side note the material feels very durable and the straps are awesome but yeah the sizes are off
customer_reviews.author: ElMarine18

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Great material, but I ordered a 17 to 19 ft and it really does not fit my 19 ft. I mean with serious stretching and tugging I was able to make it work but better order the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: lindsey armas

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be aware!
customer_reviews.text: Two thumbs down on Leader Accessories customer service. I’ve have been an Amazon Prime member for several years, ordered ~100 items without issue - until now. They sell a boat cover for a 16’ boat, it doesn’t fit a 16’ boat. I tried everything I could think of to stretch the product the couple extra inches I needed. Now they won’t take it back and refund my money or offer an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Don L.

customer_reviews.title: This is a fair cover for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cover a 23 ft Yamaha, not the easiest boat to fit. This cover arrived on time and is large enough to easily cover my boat. The attention to detail is good with reinforced corners and solid buckles and straps. It fits a bit baggy, so I would not use it as a cover on the road. As for rain protection, I do have the original Yamaha cover (worn out) and its support poles and straps under this one to help keep rain from pooling. The boat stays dry now. This is a fair cover for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: B. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cover, buy one size bigger!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size bigger then I needed and am glad I did. My 15 ft runabout has high side rails and a center type counsel. The extra allowed me to cover the motor with extra to spare. Comes with plenty of straps so it all snugs down fine. These pics are after a two hour freeway trip back from the lake so the cover has shifted a bit. Even with speeds up to 70 mph we had no issues. Good product, I would buy it again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A.

customer_reviews.title: Faded after only a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: Faded after only a couple weeks which is no big deal, but why have color choices if they fad immediately? So far it seems ok. Center poll fell over and water collected, but I don't think it leaked. I have center poll fixed with ratchet tie downs now so we will see. Fit is pretty nice. However I ordered the 16 to 17 foot for my 15 foot boat and it was way too short and not wide enough. Stepped up one lager size (I think 18 to 19" and all is ok, but this version is cut out around back leaving outboard motor exposed. Strap tie downs are nice and holding up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a custom cover
customer_reviews.text: I have had this cover for a few weeks and so far it is great. I have a Hurricane 2200 sundeck outboard and this covers from the tip of the bow to the top of the motor. Fits snugly and plenty of reach with the included buckles. I do have to cross the very center to the opposing side due to insufficient length, but that is very minor. When not trailering, I don’t bother to connect the very center. I hope this weathers well, if I get 3 years out of it I will consider it a huge win at this price.
customer_reviews.author: nam11b

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, but buy one size too big.
customer_reviews.text: This boat cover feels very durable and is a great buy. My only reason for 3 stars and not 5 is that the sizing chart needs to be adjusted. I bought model A for a standard 15ft aluminum boat, but the cover is a few inches to short in length, yet that's without trying to cover the motor. It's just a hassle to have to exchange it when you bought the exact model the company recommends for your boat. As I saw in many other reviews, I would suggest getting one size bigger than the chart recommends. Especially in the case that your boat has a windshield or you're planning on covering the motor too.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Baudendistel

customer_reviews.title: Worked as Intended for about 1 - 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved the cover for about the first 1 to 2 months. After that, it did not keep the water out at all. I've applied waterproofing to it multiple times and it helps a little. After less than 8 months of service, the cover has faded to almost white and adding waterproofing doesn't help any more. You can actually see thru the material when you hold it up in the light. I realize it is an inexpensive cover and would have been happy to replace it every couple of years, but every couple of months is not acceptable. Additionally, when I contacted Leader customer support, I got absolutely no response.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The higher the denier (i.e. 600D vs 300D) the more rugged the product. My horse wears a 1200D winter blanket which he rubs on trees and rolls in the mud while wearing. Your boat doesn't do those things unless you are really bad at backing your trailer. Your boat will probably be fine with 600D. This is probably the minimum denier for covering a boat if you want to haul it covered successfully.
customer_reviews.author: joan dobbert

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good fit.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second cover I have purchased from this company. The first was way too huge both in length and beam width. The first cover had a cut out for the motor, but sadly, this one doesn't. This was in the warehouse so it was less that half price...I can do a few modifications to make it fit. This one said the color was gray, it was olive...I can live with it...it just doesn't match the motor cover now.
customer_reviews.author: flyfishinwoman

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to fitting transom
customer_reviews.text: Received cover (14-16'L 68"W) today for my 14 Gregor. The cover had a good fit right up until the transom that's were the corner supports are sewn in at 48". Huh! I don't recall any 14-16' boat with a 48" transom unless it's a canoe. I will be returning cover.
customer_reviews.author: justfishsalt

customer_reviews.title: Boat Cover is all that was advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The supplied tie downs are great. The design with the supports running all the way across the fabric seems like a very good idea. The way is fits the stern on the boat is much nicer than my last cover. Now only time will tell if it holds up. I've been having some bad luck with some covers not lasting very long and this one is only a month old, but I have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: leader cover
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty cover we will see how this summers temps bake the cover so far looks good not cheap like the other imports...hope fully this one last couple years.....good straps and clips and plenty long and large. i did order the next size up one than i needed thank god and fits perfectly.... i also ordered the stand for the middle to keep the water from puddling in the middle of boat..... i know this will help....only time will tell but to me seems a good product...
customer_reviews.author: CHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be good quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very good quality, fit excellent for not being custom made. Will see how it stands up to going down the road?! UPDATE: after purchasing this cover for our trip 5 hours north.......I can now say after just over 10 hours of highway and interstate travel, it is well worth the money!! No indication what so ever of any failure anytime soon. Works and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and seems to be holding up to the weather. The only complaint I have is with a V hull is when it rains the cover sags in front of the windshield causing water to pool in the cover. If they would move the tie down strap back about a foot I believe it would solve that problem. Overall it's doing okay. I'm waiting to see how long it'll last before needing replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Vaught

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to sun and wind/rain.
customer_reviews.text: We put it on our boat in Airizona. Hopefully it's going to last a couple years. I purchased the 20-22 foot cover for our Open Bow 20 foot boat and it had a little extra length which was fine. The straps that come with it are really great. The fit was very good. Time we'll tell. I didn't rate the water resistance yet only because we haven't experienced this yet. The cover seems to be good quality. My husband was plesently surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty cover
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty cover. My 15'5" Tri hull with 64" beam needed the 90" beam 14'-16' size. I guess with the top folded down and a full windshield it needed the wider size. The 68" beam size didn't overlap the sides, but the 90" covered the sides about 8"-10" so was perfect and the length cover across the front with room to spare. So works well on a Tri hull. Leader made the return without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 1/2 year & ripped from ice forming on top
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking cover at first, I live in the north country where we get snow & ice. After the first winter the cover was stretched from water puddling between the straps. I fastened the cover & supports as taught as possible. Winter 2 I went out to clear the cover off & found the fabric torn from maybe 20 Lbs of ice. If you buy this cover plan on a yearly replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Adirondaker

customer_reviews.title: The model E fit fine but had lots of extra baggy cover leftover in ...
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered the cover- first got a model E (20-23 ft) and here are my boats specs: 1993 Caravell Legend- 19.8ft long and 92 inch beam. The model E fit fine but had lots of extra baggy cover leftover in front and even in back - returned thru amazon and ordered the model D (17-19ft) and fits like a glove! The elastic bottom stretches over the back side perfectly and ties down so well that it probably doesn’t need a pole. I cannot review it’s water repellancy yet- but it looks great and fits really well. I also have not trailered yet and probably will not (no real need unless it’s raining while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Best

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This cover fit just as described. It is a higher quality material than I expected too. You may need to purchase the rod that holds the canvas up so water doesn't puddle in the middle and stretch the stitching. Good value. I bought one size larger just to be sure, but I didn't need to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Product significantly faded by end of 1st year of use. After 18 months it started allowing rain to penetrate. Fits short but wide. Couldn’t get ti tight enough to provenir sag, so I bough additional props to hold the cover up to allow runoff, but it still allows rain to penetrate.
customer_reviews.author: GoneGhoti-ing

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 years....then
customer_reviews.text: Bought in February 2019. Cover fit well. Seemed like good quality. It is May 2020 and it is shredding. Material has worn out and is thin. I live in N. California so the sun is not really a factor. I will buy it again but I'm thinking I should have purchased the custom cover that it orginally came with for $500 because that one lasted close to 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but needs improvements
customer_reviews.text: The straps for the middle and at sections of the boat could be about 2 feel longer (my girl is a little big in the middle LOL) and I would like a repositioned, or additional strap-point near the bow as there always seems to be an un-tentioned spot that will collect water at the bow. I've tried a combination of clamps, tightening, and poles inside the boat at the bow to reduce the problem which works, but adds a degree of difficulty and inconvenience. They good news is that otherwise it fits my 20' Chris Craft bow rider well and keeps the water out
customer_reviews.author: Terry Roussell

customer_reviews.title: Didn't try it until just before a trip where it ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't try it until just before a trip where it rained. Left dark marks on the paint which had to be washed off. I returned it. It might be ok if it's washed first or something. I might order a different color or something in the future.
customer_reviews.author: K3883

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional quality and design, this cover is by far the best fabric, stitching and detail I've had. Because my boat now sits outdoors I've always kept a general purpose boat cover over the custom cover to protect the custom cover ($1000 cost) from UV damage. This cover is 3 times thicker material than any found in big box stores but at the same price! Excellent choice & value.
customer_reviews.author: jack sink

customer_reviews.title: small on beam measurement
customer_reviews.text: I suspect that these only fit the stated beam measurement on a bass boat style with nothing above the gunwales, and even then will just reach over the edge. Otherwise good quality, but too narrow for a V hull style runabout with a windshield in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: In the AmaZone

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not as described.  Expected a little more.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item on May 14th and it is now June 20th so I have had for about a month. The cover fits well on my boat and seems to be heavy enough to lost a couple seasons. I purchased the green color and it is already begun to fade. The other issue I have is in the description it says it is waterproof. It is definitely not waterproof. It is more like water resistant. If you have rain for any length of time the cover gets saturated and will start to drip at various spots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit some tri-hulls
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be holding up well but the color faded in just a few weeks. Also this model says suited for a tri-hull but does not fit my Silverline Comoro well at all. Way to narrow at front. Mines an 18'.
customer_reviews.author: James Van Meter

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just had a few days so can’t say on durability but so far so good. I have a 19 foot bass boat and I sized up to the 20-22” and there’s a lot of room. I probably could have went down the the exact size but I do take the fishing seats off before I put the cover on.
customer_reviews.author: Halie Bidwell

customer_reviews.title: Great cover
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because of the price. Now that I have the product and put it on my boat I like it even more for the quality. For the price I paid I don’t think you could get a better cover. Repels water,Thicker grade material and straps seem sturdy. I haven’t driven with that yet so I’m not sure how well a hold up driving down the road from what I seen I don’t think that will be an issue. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!  Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have an old 16’ ski boat with outboard. I ordered a size larger than the dimensions based on other reviews. Length wise it’s a good fit, it’s a little too wide, but given the included straps, it snugs down over my boat quite well! Very good quality product that looks nice on my boat. I live on the coast and have no concern that the cover will protect my boat even in the worst storms. I wish they made an outboard motor cover too!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I have an 18' boat and went with the size up for 20-22'. It fits great with the troller on the bow. I will not trailer with it and don't care too much if it's waterproof. It'll be water resistant and keep the sun off it, and that's all I want.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Boat Soaked!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cover for use when the boat was not under covered storage. When the time came and storms were forecast, I installed the cover. I used manufacturer recommended technique and tented the cover to not allow pooling. The next day I found my boat full of water. Every surface was wet. The seats, the carpet, the dash all wet. Unfortunately, I missed my return window by a week. HIGHLY UNSATISFIED!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This high quality cover in size 14-16' fit my 15.5 foot speedboat perfectly. It even has an outboard cover built in. I will probably fold that under and not use it, but it is a nice option. The straps go around your boat, unlike the first picture shows. Also not visible in that picture is the strap that connects on the very front to hold that down. Look at the second picture to get a better idea of the straps. I would buy this again or recommend it to anybody. It is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry F.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product thruout at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Used on a Hydro Force OMC FISH AND Ski 17' + boat with custom support in front of windshield and at rear fishing seat position, also covered outboard engine like it had been made that way. Only required a few extra hold down bungie cords(6) to be perfect for my application, looked like a custom made cover. Has been wind and rain tested in the last few weeks in the severe storms in Ft Worth, Texas, no problems or leaks!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny R. Blocker

customer_reviews.title: Well made and perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Using this top on a Lund Explorer 1600. It fit perfectly. The top seems to be very well made. The provided straps make the setup/install very easy. I used a couple of supports inside the boat to keep the snow from "caving" in the top during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: RickS

customer_reviews.title: Good Cover, but keep to the Neutral Colors
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these covers... the First was the Grey in Sept 2016 and it lasted through 2 winters in Alabama. This boat stays outside, so cover is exposed 100% of the time. ultimately I had to put a center support in to keep it from pooling water, but worked perfectly fine. The second cover purchased was the green in March 2019. I am disappointed in it because of the fading, the color has faded real fast. I did notice the fading on the Grey cover, however it just wasn't as obvious because of it being Grey.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W.

customer_reviews.title: Leader Accessories Polyester Waterproof Trailerable Runabout Boat Cover
customer_reviews.text: This cover is a quality material and fits correctly. If it is being used to cover a boat for outdoor storage you will need to add prop poles for proper water run off. I like that the hold down straps are sewn on the cover from one side to the other and completely circle the trailer. The outboard cut out was a plus and did fit my boat correctly. Overall, I would give the cover a solid 4 out of 5. I do believe the cover could have used 1 or 2 more hold down straps sewn in at strategic points. I would suggest this tarp for storage more than covered trailing. DPS
customer_reviews.author: DPS

customer_reviews.title: It’ll work for now.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the size per the chart, it’s really narrow, just barely made it past the rubber bumper edging on both sides. The straps were a little confusing. The mesh bag is 5 times bigger than it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: N. D. Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, eventually
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cover 15.5 ft long bass boat including front and rear seats, 68 inch beam, front trolling motor. Had to get the 17-19ft cover with 96" beam. The next lower size would not fit across the rear of boat with seat removed (claims it covers 90" beam). It was easy to return and re-order bigger size. I like the fit, see for yourself. Too early to rate water resistance or durability. Material quality looks good though.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Girl

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good quality, fit requires some work on your part
customer_reviews.text: Fits, but very baggy and is requiring some extra effort on my end to get it to fit well. I believe this is because I have a very narrow boat (Ski Nautique). I'm going to continue to tweak my support structure to get the peak higher and hopefully get rid of some of the bagginess. The boat is in the water now, and so is the cover because it hangs down the freeboard. Material feels good and stiching seems to be strong, and the clips have a nice click to them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D Plante

customer_reviews.title: Decent Storage Cover for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a 1995 Larson 194 LXI. The tarp is just barely long enough. The cover does not extend down to the bow/rub rail. The straps were too short so I had to get creative with those. The boat only has a 96" beam so I expected a better fit. The material is too thin to trailer speeds. I took it off for moving the boat. It's ok for a driveway cover.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great cover!
customer_reviews.text: I have an open aluminum fishing boat that is exactly 14 feet from bow to stern. The covers are sized for boats that are 12 to 14 feet and 14 to 16 feet. I was somewhat uncertain which to buy but I chose to buy the 14 to 16 foot cover and I'm very glad I did. The length is generous, it fits easily over the trailer winch and the engine with some length to spare. Great quality cover, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect it to last...
customer_reviews.text: I had this on my boat for about 45 days. Here is my feedback. 1) black completely turned to grey from the sun. 2) the cover repels water but is not water proof, water still got into boat. 3) the plastic on front clip sewed into cover (not strap) broke and now un-useable.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Matison

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: This product has a lifespan of about two months. Construction is adequate and material appears to quality however within two months it began to leak and in the third month it did not withstand a moderate rainstorm. The primary purpose of this product is to protect from sun and water. If fails with water protection. The warranty only provided for replacement or repair and it only applies for instances where there are no "incidental or consequential" damages. I presume leaking fits this description.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A. McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Holds water well
customer_reviews.text: No issues so far after about a months use. We use it for a cover only, and do not tow with it on. Boat is parked under a tree so it gets bird droppings on it regularly so this cover protects the boat from that as well as branches and rain. Its rained a few times since we've had it and we don't have one of those cover props to hold it up from sagging but have been pleasantly surprised to come out and find about 5 gallons of rain water just sitting there, not pulling the sides off and not leaking through. Very durable and easy to clean just by spraying off with hose.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great. its faded and the clips are not doing so good but has lasted 2 winters in snow country.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Nice boat cover but not long
customer_reviews.text: I used this cover on my Stumpnocker 16’ fishing boat. It’s lightweight and pretty easy to put on. Unfortunately it hasn’t lasted very long. The Florida sun justvdestt
customer_reviews.author: R. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Actually cover for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2003 Bayliner better than any other cover I have bought before. The material that the cover is made from is very durable. Well worth the money I won't buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE G

customer_reviews.title: Quality cover for storage and protection from dust and insects.
customer_reviews.text: Very good price on a mid weight boat cover. Don’t believe it would work for towing at highway speeds but is excellent to cover my boat while on the lift in the covered boat slip.
customer_reviews.author: james mckinnon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: Great product to protect my fishing boat that is kept under a covered dock but that winds up with lots of birds flying into and out! Much easier to keep boat clean now!
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: In-season cover
customer_reviews.text: Doubt this 600D cover will hold up to towing. The material is also not heavy enough to overwinter in areas that receive snow and ice. Cover is probably best suited to use as an in-season cover if you park your boat outdoors between uses. Fit my 16' 8" fiberglass bowrider I/O (Barretta 163) with only an inch to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Woods

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The cover arrived on time. The materials used in the cover seem quite good, unfortunately the cover was defective. It was missing an belt connector that should have been sewn into the cover at a critical point needed to prevent water pooling. If the cover was not missing components I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: blkbass

customer_reviews.title: almost fit my boat perfect
customer_reviews.text: if you have a 16ft bayliner with outboard order a size bigger, barely fits my boat. it's held up to first snow storm. I will be ordering a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: robert smida

customer_reviews.title: I blame myself for not reading the reviews...
customer_reviews.text: This cover is way too small. I have a 21’ boat and this 22’ cover doesn’t reach the back. Saw a few other posts and dismissed them. My mistake. This is too small and not as advertised. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Papakevin

customer_reviews.title: Fading after a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: After a couple weeks on my boat it’s already fading. I don’t see this lasting very long, but it was only $100 so i guess I get what I pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Demian Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Great cover for the money
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, not like custom, but a lot less than a custom cover. Snitch work was well done and tie down straps are well positioned Water proof
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FITS LIKE A GLOVE :)  on 18' Ranger Bass Boat.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. We purchased this to cover our 18 ft ranger bass boat. It has a 150 outboard motor and this fits like a glove. With that being said it is literally like a glove and will require two people to get it into place, but it is exactly what we were looking for. Thanks so much for this heavy made great product!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddictHere

customer_reviews.title: First One Was Better
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cover. Last one was wonderful. Same company, same size. I always get a bit of drooping in the center near the stern over time... but this year, the cover started leaking water inside the boat after the first rain! Soaked! What's the point in spending good money on a cover if it leaks water?
customer_reviews.author: Keith Yoder

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t fit boat it said it would fit. Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Our boat is in the size range it said this would fit but it was actually too small. Had to return for a different size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Kimber C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Value!
customer_reviews.text: Leader makes the best value boat cover! We've tried expensive covers and cheap covers, but this Leader cover lasted for multiple seasons at a great price! So we bought it again!
customer_reviews.author: Mariam Denton

customer_reviews.title: very good quality- measure twice!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you measure your boat correctly when ordering. I accidentally ordered the wrong size for my boat. I took my boat on a 6 hour road trip at highway speeds and this cover held up perfectly. It is very good quality material for the money. The straps are also designed well, for travel.
customer_reviews.author: philip middleton

customer_reviews.title: Got you covered.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. Covered my 16’ sea Nymth. I order the 17’ size. I’ll add to the review in time if it holds up to the UV and heat after next summer. I hope to get at least three years use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be holding up nicely. Material is decently thick
customer_reviews.text: 16' bass boat (1987 venture stallion) Fits ok, I got the next higher size because I have a trolling motor on the front. Seems to be holding up nicely. Material is decently thick. Though I had to use a life jacket to cover up some sharper stuff. Not sure it would last in that case.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Well made, and should last.
customer_reviews.text: A little big for my boat, but I was able to make it work. I used three "poles" that I attached a cheap frisbee to the top, (to "spread out" the surface area). This allows the water to roll off, instead of pool up. It's a heavy duty cover, and I enjoy the quality. Will update after at least 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 2001 Reinell 203. Cover fit perfectly from bow to swim cover and over the top outdrive. The cover is a great deal for price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Yacht Man

customer_reviews.title: Water resistant not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Note that it's water resistant not waterproof! Water will eventually sip throug if it collects. I use a shop tarp ontop of the cover during rainy days. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amir

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Stretches at the first sign of moisture. Doesnt strap down in enough places. Threw it out after 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover
customer_reviews.text: This cover is perfect for our 10 foot bayliner. It's heavy and looks very nice. It was easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: M. Holli

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Dear sirs, I put this leader cover on my 19 foot sea ray boat currently on a trailer we experience one 6 hr Rain period. Water seeped through the cover and totally soaked the inside of my boat yesterday asking about 8 inches of water to the bow my boat I actually had to drain. I will be returning this covers for a better one. Do you have a better waterproof weather cover?
customer_reviews.author: MARK LEVESQUE

customer_reviews.title: Great boat cover.
customer_reviews.text: Quality cover. This is my 3rd boat cover. I’ve bought the cheaper ones and this is much better. Thicker durable and straps all have nice easy buckles. The reflective tape is a bonus. I use this on my center console tri hull 13’6”. Great fit it covers my outboard and hand rails.
customer_reviews.author: Ben in So. Ca

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Bought one larger than boat size to accommodate pvc structure to stretch it. Material seems strong. Straps are good and variety of option provided. Happy with it. Just bought so can’t speak for durability
customer_reviews.author: Yohana Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Would fit great except I thought since my boat was 18 feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Would fit great except I thought since my boat was 18 feet long I would go to the next size because that was at the end of what a boat cover was suppose to fit. The next size up was somewhat large but I kept it.. Will still do what I bought it for. Very happy with this boat cover.
customer_reviews.author: Dmacd

customer_reviews.title: Boat cover
customer_reviews.text: Great price and good fit! I've only had it for a few months, but it fits nicely, sheds rain well and the straps secure it down real tight. :) Only negative is it has faded quickly and some of the dye bled onto the interior upholstery. :(
customer_reviews.author: dwbruner

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF!!
customer_reviews.text: Item desc. says water proof and this cover is by no means waterproof. While I thought my boat was protected after two weeks I discovered that 100% of recent rain went directly through it. Would have returned but didnt use right away and return time expired. Completely false advertising and waste of money. Do not buy if your intent is to keep your boat dry.
customer_reviews.author: :o(

customer_reviews.title: SURPRISED AT QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: READ THE REVIEWS WAS A LITTLE SKEPTICAL BUT WHEN IT CAME IT SEEMS TO BE GREAT QUALITY. IT HAD PLENTY OF STRAPS AND IT LOOKS GREAT SO FAR. I HAVENT HAD AND RAIN YET. BUT FOR THE PRICE I AM VERY HAPPY. HAVE A 21 FT CAROLINA SKIFF AND I ORDERED BIG AND IT BARELY FITS. DEFIINTELY ORDER LARGER THAN BOAT LENGTH.
customer_reviews.author: rob kelley

customer_reviews.title: Cover was received without any clips to secure the straps ...
customer_reviews.text: Cover was received without any clips to secure the straps around the bottom of the boat or to the trailer. I tried sending a private message and comment to the company and they are not responding. Do not buy!!! Not waterproof and ruined my boat. Installed tight for winter and this summer the boat is filled with water. No way for water to get in other than through the fabric. You ruined my boat! I would have winterized another way if you would have just been honest that the cover was not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job keeping the rain out of our boat. Has lots of ties for strapping it down.
customer_reviews.author: dianejw

customer_reviews.title: Meets the task required
customer_reviews.text: Cover for the boat nicely. It was missing some straps and while the company said they would send, I never received them but since I use primarily to keep out dust and pests, the ones that came with it are sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: NickRich

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service .............
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad boat cover but its made for an outboard. Tried to contact customer service to exchange for an inboard cover but never did get a response. Its made pretty well for what they charge, just dont expect to get a follow up from the company if you have an issue with it. Thats its only getting 3 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: LambFam

customer_reviews.title: This is designed as a v hull cover.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a well made cover. It was somewhat misleading saying it also fit a tri hull boat. When installed, the point at the bow of the boat is nothing but extra dangling fabric. It fits, just not like a glove....
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Frazier jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and truly heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: tried other cheaper "heavy duty" covers, the others sucked (weren't heavy duty), this one is good
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Grant

customer_reviews.title: The snaps don't work on this cover, they don't ...
customer_reviews.text: The snaps don't work on this cover, they don't hold ?? The old saying "you get what you paid for" applies here. It does hold back the water, it's raining currently outside and it seems to be shedding the water but now I have to buy new snaps, I'm afraid to take it out on the highway., it's liable to end up on someone's windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Krista DeLaney

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Was going to cheap out and buy what was available at the local "W" Mart - glad we opted to pony up a little more dough, I think it will be well worth it. Protecting our boat is important and this cover should do the job and then some. NOT thin and cheap. Fit our 19 ft. 1994 Bayliner bowrider perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Not recomended
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this cover the 22 22 ft cover and it started to rain and I climbed inside the boat and they were leaks all over the seems of the cover is a terrible design I never had to cover that would let the water go inside the boat definitely not recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: Nice for off season. Protects varnished finishes and interior of boat.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the quality of the product!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in a timely manner, as expected, and was in a quality mesh bag with all the parts present. The durability seems better than what I have purchased from local stores in my area. Overall, I am very pleased with the fit on the boat. I purchased it a little big on purpose because of support poles, a swim deck addition, and a bimini I have to go over. It fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Smosvold

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, thick material but too short and narrow
customer_reviews.text: This cover is sturdy but does not reach over the stern or very far down the sides. 600d material seems thicker than brightent's 600d, it feels thick like a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: nc2345

customer_reviews.title: Tough cover
customer_reviews.text: Material construction was heavy duty for the price. Draw string and tie downs almost eliminated the need for poles in front and passenger compartment.
customer_reviews.author: madoc

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect, it was a gift for a friend and he was thrilled
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Cover too small.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice cover but is too small to fit my boat. My measurements are well within the stated dimensions in the description but the cover isnt even close to fitting correctly. Update: Reached out to Leader via their website. Gave them my dimensions, asked why the cover didn't fit and how to reorder. I received NO reply.
customer_reviews.author: T. Germusa

customer_reviews.title: It fades quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This boat cover works great but has one major flaw. The dark green color has faded after just one month in the sun. The cover itself fits my 18.5 side console jon boat like a glove. Just long enough to also cover the outboard. Straps and buckles are well made and durable. Keeps water out. But it fades, even after spraying it with a UV spray coating.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: This is the thickest and best quality cover i have owned (including the ones i ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the thickest and best quality cover i have owned (including the ones i spent $500 on in the stores). I bought a new boat and gave this one to a friend, but bought a bigger one for my new boat. Only down fall were the buckles on the straps. Not same quality as the cover itself. One broke right away and 2 others didnt snap in right. My new one, however, works perfect so either they upgraded buckles or i just got a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Faded in 4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Had this cover on my boat for 4 weeks and it faded badly. Buy a potato get a potato. Also now leaks rain through the material. DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Captian Don

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: Cover fits great. I have a 18ft Crestliner with bow rails. Ordered 18ft-19ft. Fits just like my last cover from Cabelas. Covers my outboards also! Quality is not as good. But its cost it great. And I would order again if needed. We have received several inches of rain since installing and its bone dry!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boat cover.
customer_reviews.text: Great tarp for my bass boat, glad I picked this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jhjudge

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Great cover, sturdy. Straps are long enough for boat but not if you have a wakeboard rack.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Comyns

customer_reviews.title: Fades quickly
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months, this product faded so much it lost almost all color. It still keeps water out though.
customer_reviews.author: RMRJMR

customer_reviews.title: Great cover.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace old cover. Worked great. Straps to secure are sturdy and hold the cover in well.
customer_reviews.author: M Irwin

product_meta.title: Leader Accessories 600D Waterproof Trailerable Runabout Boat Cover Fit V-Hull Tri-Hull Fishing Ski Pro-Style Bass Boats, Full Size
feature_bullets: [TYPE] Model A:14'-16'L Beam Width up to 68". Fits V-hull runabouts(outboards and I/O). 6 adjustable straps included.

[MATERIAL AND STITCH] Made of ShoreMaster 7.25 oz. 600D heavy duty marine grade polyester fabric with double PU coating. Treated for water repellency, UV and mildew resistance. Double stitched seams with straps reinforced to decrease water entering from the stitching. Every top seam is inforced with 1 inch poly-web straps for a long haul. Extra protective reinforcements on the rear corners, the middle and the front gives an extra protection for key parts.

[TRAILERABLE AND EASY TO USE] Perfect for both trailering and storage. Elastic cord in bottom hem gives a tight fit. Rear air vents allow inside moisture to escape. Free mesh storage bag included. Quick release buckles and strap system on the cover ensures easy fitting. 6 adjustable straps for Model A, 7 for Model B/C/D/E, 8 for Model F.

[RECOMMENDATION AND WARRANTY] Model A/B/D/E/F are for outboards and I/O. Only Model C has a cutout design for outboard. Please measure your boat first and check the size chart in our description. Move Up To Next Size if the measurement falls on maximum length. To improve waterproof effect and extend the lifespan of cover, it's highly recommend to use support poles to avoid pooling from water in center of cover. Customer friendly 2-year limited warranty. Any questions, please contact us anytime.

[CARE AND MAINTENANCE] Please do not allow the product to get in touch with sharp objects, chemicals, gasoline, or liquids. Spot clean with water, do not use detergent. Hang cover to dry and use storage bag to keep cover clean and stowed away when not in use. Be sure your boat is thoroughly dry before covering for long time storage.
